Excel functions explanation series | Learn how to convert case using the UPPER and LOWER functions in Excel
Explanation of the UPPER function in Excel
Explanation of the LOWER function in Excel
Explanation of the PROPER function in Excel

The UPPER, LOWER, and PROPER functions are important tools in Excel for text formatting.
The UPPER function converts all characters in the text to capital letters.
Conversely,
The LOWER function converts all characters in the text to lowercase letters.
As for the PROPER function, it converts the first letter of each word to a capital letter and all other letters to lowercase letters.
These functions can be used to convert texts entered into Excel into the required format, such as formatting the names of customers or suppliers, or formatting sentences in worksheets.

The UPPER function in Excel is a text function used to convert all characters in a text string to uppercase letters (uppercase letters). The function is used as follows:

=UPPER(text)

Where "text" is the text string that you want to convert to uppercase.

For example, if we had the text "hello, world!" in cell A1, and we want to convert it to uppercase, we can use the UPPER function like this:

=UPPER(A1)

The text will be converted to "HELLO, WORLD!".

The UPPER function can be used by itself, or in another syntax such as the CONCATENATE function to group text while preserving its capitalization.

Excel functions explanation series | Learn how to convert case using the UPPER and LOWER functions in Excel
Explanation of the UPPER function in Excel
Explanation of the LOWER function in Excel
Explanation of the PROPER function in Excel

The UPPER, LOWER, and PROPER functions are important tools in Excel for text formatting.
The UPPER function converts all characters in the text to capital letters.
Conversely,
The LOWER function converts all characters in the text to lowercase letters.
As for the PROPER function, it converts the first letter of each word to a capital letter and all other letters to lowercase letters.
These functions can be used to convert texts entered into Excel into the required format, such as formatting the names of customers or suppliers, or formatting sentences in worksheets.

The UPPER function in Excel is a text function used to convert all characters in a text string to uppercase letters (uppercase letters). The function is used as follows:

=UPPER(text)

Where "text" is the text string that you want to convert to uppercase.

For example, if we had the text "hello, world!" in cell A1, and we want to convert it to uppercase, we can use the UPPER function like this:

=UPPER(A1)

The text will be converted to "HELLO, WORLD!".

The UPPER function can be used by itself, or in another syntax such as the CONCATENATE function to group text while preserving its capitalization.
